Datatable.LocalizationPair: Utterly inhospitable, these planets are so cold that even the air has frozen, rendering them without even the most scant of atmospheres to cover their nakedness. Staying alive, never mind, living, is a huge challenge, but the scientific insights more than make up for the hardship.

Positively mild compared to their frozen gas siblings, these worlds are nonetheless only a hundred or so degrees above absolute zero, and contain all manner of weird and wonderful chemistry from rivers of liquid nitrogen to lakes of methane. Nerd heaven.

Occupying a Dust "goldilocks" zone, vapor gas worlds are an incredible source of the near-magical substance--if you've got the tech to survive on a surface that makes quicksand seem like a safe bet for walking on. Leave the kids at home if you visit.
Incredible sunsets the brochure says, failing to mention the methane rain, toxic clouds, and a hundred other lethal aspects. Dust deposits are off the charts though, so fortunes can be made.

Devoid of any life, this world is a scorching hellhole of fiery winds and molten lakes. Expect any residents to feel aggrieved at the hand life has dealt them, but as an industrial base it cannot be beaten.

In a different life, this planet would've leapt on the path to full starhood. A little closer to the igniting heat of a companion sun, a little more gravitation, a passing nebulae, and this place could've been a photon factory. Still, industry loves these planets and their furnace-like conditions.

Favored by monsters and hermits, swamp worlds offer fetid bogs, thick mists, and decent yields of methane gas. Less widely known, however, is their capacity for producing incredible crops of funky, yet still edible, fungi, due to the perfect conditions of moisture and mulch.

Colonization of Swamp-type planets relies on inventions that master the various systems needed for filtration and drainage, as deadly chemicals and radiation are often abundant in the atmosphere and soil. The environments are deadly and unforgiving if these processes are not executed perfectly.

Typified by dense magnetic cores of molten iron, Alpine planets allow scientists to explore a range of atmospheric, electromagnetic, and cosmic ray interactions in a chilly climate. Expect hardwoods and shaggy-haired mammals.

Cold and moist, Alpine-type worlds provide challenges for settlers and industries that are often seduced by clever marketing brochures whose photos were taken in summer. Though potentially welcoming and productive, much of the year the environment is forbidding and must be treated with caution.

Teeming with animal life and vegetation in spite of its relative cold, terraformation into a Alpine-type planet requires introduction of a wide range of species and a soil sufficiently rich to serve as the base of the ecosystem.
Burning worlds, with their sweltering surfaces and furnace-like interiors, assist in the flow of heavier elements from the core to the crust. As a result industry thrives.
Freezing worlds offer harsh environments where strict discipline and careful deliberation are the keys to survival. Perhaps this is why science tends to prosper.
A temperate world offers conditions that are usually comfortable for the majority of species in the galaxy. On these planets, a broad range of activities can usually flourish.

Rich with life of many varieties, fertile planets offer plenty of sustenance. Dust reserves, however, are generally low as the biosphere has distributed any concentrated pockets into trace amounts across the entire world.
Mild planets constitute the vast majority of habitable planets in the Galaxy, being neither easy nor hard to settle, they offer only average yields.
Life may be relatively rare on harsh planets, but the relative absence of organisms means that these worlds are largely untouched by the sands of time and are full of opportunities.
Plants everywhere, people living on these worlds do not have to fear about ever lacking food, on the other hand, it's a nightmare for those suffering from dendrophobia.
Water-rich worlds, regardless of salinity levels, tend to be very accommodating to life in all its myriad forms, they also happen to make fantastic natural touristic attractions.
These worlds suffer from high tectonic activity resulting in lots of areas with an easy access to resources from the crust. While disliked by most individuals, industrialists tend to love them.
Lacking much water, dry worlds are hard places for new colonists, but there is a silver lining: Dust veins tend to be abundant. Why? Prospectors neither know nor care.
These worlds offer a stable environment that makes it easier for scientists to replicate their experiments and, as such, make prime locations for laboratories.

Gas-type planets rarely engender their own lifeforms, the environments often too chaotic or toxic for life to be established. Conversely, most species who've evolved in more stable climates, find the transition to life on gas-planets extremely tough, but the rewards can be extraordinary.
This planet is suitable to spawn a Guardian.
Convert 1 [population] into 150 [ManpowerColored]. Manpower gained increases with Enrollment Rate.
Convert 150 [lifeforceColored] into 350 [ManpowerColored]. Manpower gained increases with Enrollment Rate.

40% of Industry spent for any construction is converted into Dust at the end

+4% Damage on weapons modules and Troop Damage per turn up to 40%
Security Bill to Ensure Supply Routes Clearance

Careful organization of new patrol sweeps around the most frequently used supply routes results in a huge decrease in piracy and helps you reduce the cost associated with maintaining all fleets and system improvements in working condition.

As a starfaring race, your people are always fascinated when they hear of the new wonders the Galaxy can hide, and as such, it is easy to convince them of the benefit of increased taxes to unlock more fundings towards space exploration.

Keeping a close hand on education and apprenticeship systems allows the Senate to funnel the empire's greatest minds where they are most needed. This law, if passed, will result in a stronger and more efficient scientific workforce.

Concerned by an increasing level of galactic conflict, the Senate pulls together a series of standards and regulations to increase the output of shield systems. While decried by some as paranoid, many feel that one's shield can never be too big.
Enemies cannot retreat when faced against you in a space battle.
Cannot get banned from the Marketplace

While not enabling carte-blanche terraforming, the ability to construct robust structures that can adapt to changing conditions, allows planets to be altered into more benign versions of their essential type.

Sufficient experience with terraforming projects and complex geo-atmospheric sciences has led to an increase in overall terraforming performance. Given time and money, your engineers and scientists can now terraform planets into the most lush and productive planet types.
If the other empire declines the terms, you can apply this effect.
You need at least 80 siege power to use this tactic (the value only gets updated when you start the invasion or at the start of the turn).

Counters Guerilla Tactics and is countered by Combined Arms.
Counters Combined Arms and is countered by Indirect Fire Support.
Masters of rapid, hard-hitting strike attacks, anyone can learn from observing Tikanan assault tactics. Counters Combined Arms and is countered by Indirect Fire Support.
Your ships will bombard the fighting area before launching the battle. This tactic cannot be countered.
Counters Indirect Fire Support and is countered by Guerilla Tactics.
Counters Carpet Bombing and is countered by Infiltration. Note: Converted population is lost forever.
Counters Carpet Bombing and is countered by Infiltration. Note: Converted population is lost forever.
Counters Infiltration and is countered by Armoured Spearhead.

Gnashast are fiercely protective of their own territory. This is reflected in the aggressive manner in which they take the battle to invaders. Counters Infiltration and is countered by Armoured Spearhead.

Surrender to protect Population and Improvements, but organize a resistance network to increase the transitionary period in order to bring your fleets and retake the system or at least penalize the opponent.
Utilizing their decentralized nature, Bhagaba can surrender en-masse, helping to protect both infrastructure and population, while lengthening the transitionary period.
Counters Armoured Spearhead and is countered by Carpet Bombing.

One of your obliterator(s) fired less than a few turns ago.

Prevents the destruction of your system if it is targeted by an Obliterator. This Improvement is destroyed when it is used but its effects linger for a few turns. Only 35% of population is killed, 35% of improvements (25% of Defense Improvements) are destroyed, and 50% damage is done to Ships in orbit. If a Hero is defending, they are injured 33% of the time.
Behemoths represent #E3BDAC#10#REVERT# [commandPoint] (Command Points) of their fleet. Hull Weakness: #E3BDAC#500#REVERT# (see defense absorption)

There are weapon modules equipped already. Remove them first before adding an advanced probe module.
+2 #FFFFFF#[commandPoint]#REVERT# per Level 4 Systems with Autonomous Administration on Empire

This top-secret law orders a cabal of the empire's most eminent scientists and engineers to form up a working group charged with inventing cutting-edge science with practical applications. The result? Your empire can research state-of-the-art technologies even faster.
The chances for a planet to be rich in resources
High chance of rich deposits, low chance of poor deposits.
Setting to adjust the multiplier for the amount of resource deposits in the whole galaxy for every resource.
Enrollment rate (used when converting Population [Population] into Manpower [manpowerColored])
No valid visible path: Explore the galaxy more, or unlock the Science and Exploration 3rd stage for warp drives.
There is no path leading to this node, your ships need warp (free) movement. Unlock the Science and Exploration 3rd stage for warp drives.
Can only be installed on [hero] or [support] Ships
+1 on Module effect multiplier on Hero ship
As one of the living few Endless, through sheer force of personality built on an unshakeable faith, the Hero rallies the entire empire with powerful, spine-tingling orations.
Industrialist Heroes are well known for their faculties to boost local production, and it would seem this one is rather attached to this stereotype.

Well versed in the sciences of Engineering, the Hero himself supervises the repairs of his fleet's ships to remove any weakness in their hulls. He also writes educational books in his spare time to teach the future generations on how to optimize structural integrity which leads to a decrease in repair costs all across the Empire.

The Hero leads a promotional campaign for the integration of neural implants in the brains of the local young students that gives them near instant and permanent memorization of any information they come across, which leads to a boost in Science across the System.

Always hungry for more knowledge, the Hero analyzes every battle data he has access to in order to optimize his fleet's defensive capabilities. As a party leader, he also gathers detailed reports from every fleet in the Empire and then shares his discoveries with his fellow scientists.
The Hero uses his near-hypnotical Dust-enhanced abilities to persuade local entrepreneurs of the benefit of luxury resources, thus leading to increased yields in the system.
The Hero uses his persuasion skills on prisoners of war in the hopes of gaining political leverage against mutual enemies.
By sharing his vast knowledge of crop genome with the local farmers, the Hero is able to raise the food output significantly.

Personal supervision of the diet of every other Dust-enhanced individual in the Empire leads to a decreased downtime of Heroes after an injury. The Hero also optimizes the food production facilities aboard his fleet needed to feed ground invasion armies during their long journeys.
A new ministry overseen by the Hero is created. Its goal : to convince the masses that becoming benefactors of their local religious organizations will make them happier.

By regularly creating ship dummies from Dust clouds, the Hero is able to fool the enemy targeting systems and thus increase his fleet's survivability. After the battle, the Dust clouds also help with the repairs of any fleet passing by, reducing their upkeep.
The best defense is a good offense, the Hero uses this doctrine to increase the odds of winning the defensive ground battles he's taking part in.

As head of the party, the Hero tries to promote the benefit of emergency shelters across the empire. To further reinforce his point, he also installs Dust-controlled shelters on his fleet's weapons, reducing their downtime when they get targeted.

Planets led by Guardians are amongst the most secure places in the Galaxy, by keeping detailed records of every able-bodied individual, the Hero is capable of rapidly organizing unparalled defenses when the system is attacked.

The outward appearance of an Overseer Hero's fleet is always meticulous. By spending a little of their discretionary budgets on sturdy bulkheads and reflective paints, the Hero actually increases the fleet's effectiveness in combat as well.

The Counselor Hero introduces a just culture system to his fleet to ensure crewmembers report problems as soon as they arise and ensure they are contained effectively. Small crafts benefit the most from this measure.
For the eusocial species, the health of the entire superorganism is paramount. Weak individuals are rejected. As such, the Hero has no place for crewmembers who aren't in tip-top shape.
Based on the previous rocket design, greater range has been attained by reducing the size and mass of the mining components. It is now possible to mine even more celestial objects.

Tradition, religion, and social mores tend to keep a tight rein on body evolution and the physical alteration of an individual's organism. However, for an enormous number of reasons (political, economic, and practical) governments tend more and more to let individuals freely change their physical structure through augmentations, grafts, clones, implantations, tattoos, electronic etchings, and other alterations.

What happens when society advances to the point where all basic needs are handled by automated and indestructible systems? Labor becomes an option, and the greatest challenge is the effective use of free time.

Wars between content creators, infrastructure owners, end users, governments, and corporations sapped much of the value from the ability to network a society. By building open access to sources of research, entertainment, and news from around the universe, a boom in the use of information is paralleled by a boom in public opinion.

All-Time Air Conditioning uses advanced thermodynamics and efficient energy sources to make the daily life of Burning planet inhabitants more agreeable. They keep the advantages of clear weather, great beaches, and outdoor living, while still being able to get cool whenever they want.
You may need to research more Science and Exploration technologies to unlock Warp Drives, enabling travel outside star lanes.

Use Probes to discover new Constellations. Research more Science and Exploration technologies to unlock Warp Drives, enabling travel outside star lanes. Isolated nodes may still be in your System and may not count towards this objective.
This HQ is not able to trace a route to your Subsidiary.
Other Constellations can be found with Probes and some Quests or Events, or by unlocking wormholes.

Mastery of increasingly miniaturized thermodynamics permits the creation of heat exchange systems small enough to fit into almost any item. Using these technologies, the risk of food spoiling is essentially reduced to zero.

Crops are no longer recognizable as the plants from which they sprung. Nano-enhanced and genetically modified, healthy and immortal plants are food factories that run year-round, regardless of the weather. Continually harvested, self-fertilizing, and auto-regulating, the food supply will simply never run out.

Technologies of transport and refrigeration tied to the monitoring of lifestyles and behavioral analytics all come together to ensure that the 30-40% of the food supply that is usually wasted or thrown out becomes available for consumption. An incredibly complex system, it nevertheless creates an enormous boost in food availability.
The development of n-way fusion technology permits the creation and exploitation of fuels that are stabler and cheaper, boosting industrial output.
Now on a level with rudimentary Endless technology, the industrial base of the system has become intelligent, self-adapting, sustainable, and autonomous.

Trains change their schedules to arrive when needed. Over-crowded buildings grow extra floors. Windows adapt to maximize ambient light. Systems that handle air and waste scale up and down based on time of day, season, and long-term trends. With sufficiently advanced AI systems and self-aware materials, the self-organizing city is now a possibility.
Construction of a mass driver on nearby atmosphereless lunar bodies allows for a cheap and efficient way of transferring raw materials harvested locally across the system.

Highly automated harvesting facilities are placed on nearby lunar bodies that only require a single clone to be operated properly. Rather than remunerating them, after their three-year contracts, clones are terminated and replaced with fresh ones to maximize cost efficiency.

Part of a long-term investment program in infrastructure, the creation of space elevators across the system to transfer goods and people from planet to orbit is a resounding success. Without key materials and techniques adopted from other societies this would not have been possible.

Trade and industrial systems are providing luxuries in such an efficient and inexpensive manner that the faction is now able to export, sell, and otherwise profit from a booming luxury trade. This has never before been possible, given previous constraints of scarcity and disposable income.

Whether it's the fallout of a Dust nova or the effect of some Endless contraption, noone really understands where those deep space Dust storms come from but one thing is known for sure, it is possible to become incredibly rich by harvesting these strange phenomena.

The ability to track individual water molecules through the water cycle provides an instantaneous picture of absorption, evaporation, and precipitation across every planet. A gold mine of data is produced that improves agriculture across the Empire.

The study of how alien societies are organized and their values provides important insights into their rules and customs as to not offend foreign envoys, which helps immensely when making diplomatic demands.

By using advanced manipulation of particles that allow for the laboratory recreation of atmospheric science, it is easy to do a detailed study of atmosphere and geology in order to take advantage of a planet's unique properties.
Science has come to the point where anomalies can be recreated and studied under laboratory conditions. The anomalies unders study include black holes, entropy, stars, and dark matter.

Increased understanding of unusual particles and gravitational interactions allows system-wide installation of protective fields that stabilize planetary infrastructures. By avoiding unwanted interference from non-baryonic radiation and particle surges, elements of risk and chance are removed from industrial processes. As a result, they become more reliable, predictable, and fruitful.

Previously, option trading was a straightforward if technical calculation based on Black-Scholes and similar pricing models. However, with the inclusion of relativistic and non-relativistic frames these calculations become terrifically complex; any star system that can build the sophisticated computing and trading systems needed to deal in these options gains substantial benefits.

In the final analysis, the most valuable substance in the universe is Dust. Once the complexities of pan-galactic trade and finance are mastered, the final step in maximizing revenue and value is to exploit the fact that the currency of the known universe is alive and intelligent, and the line between a good or service and its payment is increasingly fluid. Once the fundamental nature of Dust's existence as both currency and good, theory and technology, is mastered, a state of Revenue Zen can be achieved.

The application of advanced AI routines to individual and company decisions on cash usage are surprisingly powerful. By balancing factors as diverse as weather, raw material prices, real estate trends, and political trends, money can be spent in ways that generate a 'perfect' return on investment.

The most valuable commodity in advanced society is information. Ultimately, the value of knowing when, where, and for how much to sell a good or service outweighs the value of the thing itself. With the development of exchanges that pass information at quantum-tunneled speeds, the myth of 'perfect knowledge' in economics has truly become a reality.
Creature, it appears we need to return to colder relations. Your continued intrusions, ignoring our pleas, cannot go unchallenged.
